2020-04-18T11:53:08.000Z:
Reopening Pennsylvania won't mean going back to a world of celebrations, concerts, and other large gatherings.
 
We'd still need to avoid mass groups of people to keep people safe.
2020-04-18T11:53:07.000Z:
We need more personal protective equipment and testing to reopen Pennsylvania.
 
We simply cannot keep health care workers or our public safe without these supplies.
2020-04-18T11:53:06.000Z:
Reopening Pennsylvania isn't going to be like ripping off a Band-Aid.
 
We will continue to roll out guidelines that make sense given the current situation. We will all need to continue to adapt and do whatever it takes to keep people safe.
2020-04-18T11:53:05.000Z:
As we look forward to reopening Pennsylvania, we need to keep protections for vulnerable people in place.
 
This means that even as we start getting back to work and our lives, stricter protections need to continue for people who could get very sick or die of #COVID19 .
2020-04-18T11:53:04.000Z:
I want PA to get back to normal just as much as anyone else does. But it won't happen magically, and it won't happen overnight.
 
My first focus is on the health and safety of our people, and I refuse to compromise on that. I'm relying on data and experts to plan ahead.
2020-04-17T18:15:10.000Z:
Relief for Pennsylvanians
 
We understand that people have put their lives on hold in order to save others. We also understand that comes at a cost.
 
That's why we have resources to help those struggling with food insecurity, loans, furloughs/layoffs, and closed businesses.
